2. Unable to load graphics library [GDI+ is required]

Any reason why ProgressCanvasViewer is using advanced graphics?  It requires that GDI+ be installed.
I believe they are using it to support vertical text drawing. It seems like we should protect ourselves from this on platforms where it's not supported.
This pattern can be used to detect whether advanced graphics support is available:
    gc.setAdvanced(true);
    if (gc.getAdvanced()) { ...

Given how late we are in the cycle, the simplest fix at this point would be to prevent that trim from being dropped in that area, if we don't have advanced graphics. Eric is there an easy way to do this?

If we don't have advanced graphics I'd suggest simply leaving it horizontal. The code is currently 'hard wired' to allow draggable trim to go on any side.

The conclusion reached when we decided to do away with the drop affordances during trim dragging was to make trim dropable anywhere to avoid user confusion.
OT: Will the heap status be updated to rotate when docked on the side too?

McQ, do you want to +1 this for RC4?
Steve?

Randy, I expect that eventually -all- trim will work on any side...
I want to see the code.

Adding McQ to the CC list...
You need a candidate patch attached to the bug before I can +1. Also, you need approval of a total of 3 component leads.

Fixed in >20060509.
Created an attachment (id=40804)
Patch to fix the orientation on non-GDI+ systems


I've reverted the code back to the previous version...

Adding John to CC list.

Adding Jeff to CC list (since I need +3 for this fix)
In the patch "side = SWT.BOTTOM;" looks somewhat odd, but it has the correct behavior, and I have discussed this with Erich. Given how wide the resulting trim area becomes, it's clear that no one will actually leave the progress indicator docked on the sides unless they are running with advanced graphics, but that seems reasonable to me. +1.

McQ, I agree that the code appears odd but it places the 'fix' at the true source of the issue by disallowing -any attempt- to vertically orient the trim on non-GDI+ systems.

I have verified that the trim restores to the correct location across sessions (which was my only real concern with the particulars of the fix).
Created an attachment (id=40846)
Alternative fix

I tested the patch, and it works.  However, it seems like a hack to hard-code the "side" field to SWT.BOTTOM in this case (because in reality it is still docked on the side).  If that field was ever consulted for another reason it would be returning the wrong answer.  It seems an equivalent fix is to change the isHorizontal and isVertical methods rather than faking it out by changing the side field.  Eric, does this alternative patch seem equivalent?
Created an attachment (id=40849)
Previous patch had unnecessary noise, this replaces it.


Double checked and applied John's patch...
Thanks John!

Fixed in >20060509
Verified on Win2k in I20060511-0800.  I was previously getting the GDI+ error in my log and I was able to dock the progress trim vertically with missing text.  Now I am only able to dock the progress trim horizontally and I don't get any errors in my log.

Thanks John.
Marking as CLOSED. Verified in 3.2RC4 (I20060512-1600).
You should also disable vertical docking in RTL mode on win32. GDI+ does not support mirroring it seems.
